page.title: 03Orpington Hosp.,Bromley S.E.
page.content: Orpington Hospital was built by the Canadians in the First World War to treat injured soldiers.Sir Alexander Fleming,who discovered penicillin in 1928,did some of his work there.During the Second World War it was used for treating the wounded.In 1969 attempts were made to close the hospital but, after petitions to the Department of Health and Social Security,it was saved.About 9 million pounds was spent on the new Canada Wing,which has a computer for record-keeping.The Ontario Centre is a training centre for doctors and nurses. The fight goes on to keep the Casualty Department open for 12 hours a day,and to start Phase 2 of the building programme. The area is adequately served by doctors and dentists.There is one old people's home,and a weekly baby clinic.
